title: Jungle - I can't start Blue buff now.
body:
You can clear the entire blue side of jg and not get lvl 3 because of the scuttle being gone.  How is this not disastrous to gameplay?  You practically must start red now.  Why? 

Devs acknowledge you understand this, cmon dudes, basic stuff.  Basic one target jgs, especially anyone that liked starting blue, just took huge punch to face.  Shape up.  Communicate.  Do something.

replies.body: You have to do a vertical clear that is the path.

> [{quoted}](name=mack9112,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UViT8aE7,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-05-02T05:43:35.902+0000)
>
> You have to do a vertical clear that is the path.

Going vertical while you're still level 2 is pretty risky stuff.  Exactly the kind of stuff you instantly flamed for upon failure.

How , start your red do Krugs then do there blue if they are there go bottom get skuttle clear the rest of there red side then do your blue side.  If not there they are also vertical juggling so you clear there blue side and get that scuttle

> [{quoted}](name=mack9112,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UViT8aE7,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2019-05-02T14:19:58.861+0000)
>
> How , start your red do Krugs then do there blue if they are there go bottom get skuttle clear the rest of there red side then do your blue side.  If not there they are also vertical juggling so you clear there blue side and get that scuttle

Is this a serious post?
If you can’t adapt to the jungle don’t jungle man
this guy has to be trolling XD

> [{quoted}](name=HarryMann,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UViT8aE7,comment-id=000300000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-07-05T07:42:28.072+0000)
>
> this guy has to be trolling XD

You went onto a two month old thread .. you are the troll my friend.

The patch notes are hilarious (emphasis mine):

> Right now, there's a lot of frustration between junglers and laners due to an expectation for the laner to help the jungler secure Rift Scuttler when it first spawns. At 2:00, **this tension creates forced, awkward conflict between players who at that point are barely level 2,** pushing players to pick junglers and laners that are strong at level 2 and 1, respectively.

> By moving the Scuttler's spawn time later, players will have a bit more time to plan out and assess the game before committing to taking down the Scuttler; they'll also be less **mandated to pick specific champions who are strong at early Scuttle takes.**

This is literally what players have been saying _since before Scuttle contention even went live_. Months later, Riot looks at how junglers with poor early-game dueling are nowhere to be found, and says "HMMMM look at this odd situation! But don't worry, we can fix it! You're welcome! Aren't we great?" They never even acknowledge that this was their mistake that they made in the first place and no one outside the company ever liked it. These patch notes should've instead been more like "we're sorry it took so long to fix our blunder, but like, meetings, y'know. Our bad."

The scuttle change is stupid.

However, fully clearing your **entire** blue side is almost never correct, unless you're playing some weird non-meta jungle, in which case nobody cares because you'll get shit on by any remotely knowledgeable opponent playing a meta pick anyway.

> [{quoted}](name=Yenn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UViT8aE7,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-05-02T05:55:56.104+0000)
>
> The scuttle change is stupid.
> 
> However, fully clearing your **entire** blue side is almost never correct, unless you're playing some weird non-meta jungle, in which case nobody cares because you'll get shit on by any remotely knowledgeable opponent playing a meta pick anyway.

> [{quoted}](name=KindredIsAThem,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UViT8aE7,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-05-02T06:00:59.333+0000)
>
> Clearing the entire blue side on first clear isn't even optimal. On Kindred Blue->Wolves->Red->Krugs->Scuttle feels fairly good if no ganks are available. This change is in no way disastrous, it even gives you level 4 rather quickly.

> [{quoted}](name=uNhoLeee,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UViT8aE7,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-05-02T09:22:14.296+0000)
>
> blue -> gromp -> wolves -> red.
> 
> ...

You guys are missing it, like dev team clearly is, but I'll draw you a map.  I'll start again, Blue Buff start is dead. 

You can start Red buff and clear the red side of jg, and hit level 3, before you decide to go to a scut, the other side of your jg, another side of the enemy's jg, or a gank.  With me so far?  You can even leave 3 raptors.  So enough xp in Red side alone to hit level 3 before choosing next stage of pathing.

You cannot due this with the entire blue side of the jungle.  Before at least you could do Blue > Gromp > 2 little wolves and finally the scuttler.

Naming a bunch of other pathing options is ignoring the fact that more xp on red side means red side is optimal start.



Am I wrong?  Look at this list.  LOOK AT IT.  Do YOU see the two obvious kinds of champs that win jg?

[img]https://i.imgur.com/JMOayaz.png[/img]

This is SUPER IMPORTANT because it drastically hampers the jg pool realistically down to two categories you need to fit in to have high win rate:  Fighter and AoE champ.  Not about cc, not about assassin, farming, none of that.  It's about being a jgler who is optimized to start with the red buff.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/5T5PEQi.png[/img]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JUwYZUFzs7g

btw you forgot to mark {{champion:102}}  a red buff starter.

> [{quoted}](name=Corrector1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UViT8aE7,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2019-05-02T13:16:49.999+0000)
>
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JUwYZUFzs7g
> 
> btw you forgot to mark {{champion:102}}  a red buff starter.

No look at the second picture.  Even the few champs that can do any magic damage are also marked as red buff starter and AoE.  There literally isn't one single top tier jg champ that starts blue.  Not one in a game of hundreds of champions.
Oh yeah. It’s stupid af. It’s almost like it was bad enough that we are level 9 when the enemy top is already at 14. :/

How do i get someone from Riot to respond to this?  It's an honest to god easy to see issue that one side of jg has more xp than the other when different jgs would prefer to start different buffs *if it weren't for the xp difference.*

You clearly don't understand pathing (also it shows you haven't actually played at all lately). It is not optimal pathing to do a full blue side clear into scuttle, right now you wanna get level 3 before scuttle (that was the goal of the changes).

You can still start blue, but you would need to clear 4 camps before scuttle which almost any jungler can do. Some example you can do blue/gromp/wolves/red if you are single target. You can also do Blue/Wolves/Raptors/Red if you are AoE.

If you start red buff you can do Red/Krugs/Blue to get level 3 and have time to maybe get a gank off before scuttle to make it easier to take.

If you think this is a bad change, you actually don't play jungle or play it at such a terrible level that you don't comprehend the goals it was meant to achieve.

> [{quoted}](name=BlGFISH,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UViT8aE7,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2019-05-02T18:50:20.306+0000)
>
> You clearly don't understand pathing (also it shows you haven't actually played at all lately). It is not optimal pathing to do a full blue side clear into scuttle, right now you wanna get level 3 before scuttle (that was the goal of the changes).
> 
> You can still start blue, but you would need to clear 4 camps before scuttle which almost any jungler can do. Some example you can do blue/gromp/wolves/red if you are single target. You can also do Blue/Wolves/Raptors/Red if you are AoE.
> 
> If you start red buff you can do Red/Krugs/Blue to get level 3 and have time to maybe get a gank off before scuttle to make it easier to take.
> 
> If you think this is a bad change, you actually don't play jungle or play it at such a terrible level that you don't comprehend the goals it was meant to achieve.

Are you guys being purposely obtuse? Is this what that is?  You are saying that I'm wrong, but then arguing my argument? 
"
However, fully clearing your entire blue side is almost never correct,

You clearly don't understand pathing... _**It is not optimal**_ pathing to do a full blue side clear into scuttle, right now you wanna get level 3 before scuttle (that was the goal of the changes).
"
This is exactly what I'm saying, and you're so used to parroting your impressive knowledge of the game you don't even stop to think.  YES BLUE IS SUB OPTIMAL!  THAT IS EXACLTY WHAT I AM SAYING!  THAT IS THE WHOLE POINT!  Why should one side of the jg be objectively favored as the starting side?  Because of the multiple monster camps on red side, it is better suited for certain jgs, and those are the only ones that have high success rates in jg.  Not becuase 'blue is suboptimal' as a buff, but becuase starting blue side is suboptimal = because it's rigged you can't hit level 3 on blue side.

P.S. - Seems to me like I adapt just fine.

[img]https://i.imgur.com/ee0kije.png[/img]
Scuttle change didn’t do much from the perspective of top lane.  Someone’s getting invaded level 2 anyway.  And if I’m level 1 under tower, it’s my fault my jungler died.

Also this stuff is obvious to people who would play jg.  Lowest play rate every right now.  I queue jg/top, haven't gotten autofilled a single time in over five hundred games this season.  Not a single time.   On the flip side, I just started trying to learn top, last night I queued Top/Jg, and got autofilled back into jg FIVE times in a row.  FIVE TIMES.  Just gave up after that.

What they shoulda done is have the scuttled come up at 3:15 but lower experience, and put some experience back to lvl 1 jg camps, but still make the 2nd scuttle spawn vital by having the experience that can get someone to level 6 faster.
hey i'm playing a bit of jungle lately, can you explain to me why so i didn't get it

blue -> gromp -> wolves -> red.

...
I don't see why people can't just walk to the other scuttle, that they had to delay it. Basically, bot lanes universal got their wish of not ever wanting to leave their fking lane.

Clearing the entire blue side on first clear isn't even optimal. On Kindred Blue->Wolves->Red->Krugs->Scuttle feels fairly good if no ganks are available. This change is in no way disastrous, it even gives you level 4 rather quickly.
